commit_message:
Add functional test job for cinderclient

We have functional tests merged in python-cinderclient now,
this patch adds the job to project-config to configure and
run.

Start of as experimental to make sure things are working.

Change-Id: Ie87b0d687d6be5ca74f4e3a110aa5cc754aa7085

commit_message:
FlashSystem reports error while running tests with multi-thread

There was an issue while running initialize_connection/
terminate_connection/_map_vdisk_to_host/_unmap_vdisk_from_host in
parallel threads.

This fix adds lock into these functions and removes incorrect
timer.stop().

Change-Id: If433522bc7799e16a918ba7c5b300b7333e430a8
Close-bug: 1452721

commit_message:
Update hacking to 0.10.x series

Get current release of hacking both for new features/rules and to
address a problem where older hacking requires and older version of pbr
than the version of pbr under test. This will get the pep8 jobs working
again for pbr by removing the <1.0 pbr requirement in hacking.

Change-Id: I303db998e3aa64468a931f7e8985592b3446a1c8

commit_message:
Replace ci.o.o links with docs.o.o/infra

The http://ci.openstack.org/ documentation site has been deprecated,
replaced by redirects to corresponding paths within
http://docs.openstack.org/infra/ where other Project Infrastructure
documentation already resides.

commit_message:
Create new stackforge project watcher

Watcher takes advantage of CEP and ML algorithms/metaheuristics
to improve physical resources usage through better VM placement.

Change-Id: Ib339527e90d25679cb1d9089b03b6942621ac9a6

Make `networking-midonet` tempest test vote

Since all tempest tests pass for Kilo, make them vote from now on
pre-merge gate.

commit_message:
Repo availability verification using public network

Generate config for repo availability setup with public network.
Config should contain:
- not used ip address from public network
- vlan tag in case network is tagged (0 will be used otherwise)
- gateway of public network
- list of repo urls
- iface where public network should be configured

Partial-Bug: 1439686
Change-Id: Ia588263730b9085650b10cc1f05edefcb43077cc

changes made to 5fd379f0cd8106808ab9fc098ca1094c7d91041a.

commit_message:
Revert "Merge "Fix get_monitor function and local vars for rabbit OCF""

This reverts commit 0562e2ae27c1d6b2e027e63c5af4e1153f44224b, reversing
changes made to 5fd379f0cd8106808ab9fc098ca1094c7d91041a.

The issue is that by design, the start action will start beam process
and stop the rabbit app, unless master promoted or slave joined cluster.
We have to revert aforementioned commit as it introduced a regression
to the action monitor, which is to report "Not running", when rabbit app
is stopped.

Related-bug: #1455761
Change-Id: I686c620092909351c910598aeef0dcc73d2da080
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-library refs/changes/39/184239/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: tries=5 string="$*" return $OCF_ERR_GENERIC local msg local master_node local pid local pid
deleted_lines: local tries=5 local string="$*" local a local rabbit_running local nodelist local prev_rc local max local our_uptime local node_uptime local node_start_time ocf_log info "${LH} ensuring this slave does not get promoted." else # Rabbit app is not running, report the resource is not running as well ocf_log err "${LH} rabbit app is not running!" ocf_log info "${LH} ensuring this slave does not get promoted." rc=$OCF_NOT_RUNNING master_score 0 local nodelist

commit_message:
Add repo availability verification with network setup

Repo availability with and without setup will return 
response in next format:

  {uid=> '3', status=> 1, out=>{failed_urls=>[...]}, err=>"Error message"}

Partial-Bug: 1439686
Change-Id: I3216b97df5e7b8974ac7155d06446c4419d293a1
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-astute refs/changes/75/183575/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def check_repositories_with_setup(reporter, task_id, nodes) ctx = Context.new(task_id, reporter) validate_nodes_access(ctx, nodes) Network.check_repositories_with_setup(ctx, nodes) end

Summary of changes:
* New option --no-download (-N) to skip downloads
* New option --make-default (-m) to update default repo config
* New distro ubuntu-baseos for handling trusty
* ubuntu-baseos can only be used for metadata, but not download (-N)
* added default mirror URLs for ubuntu and centos
* --apply now can use --env or --make-default or both
* Updated release to 2014.2.2-6.1 (was 2014.2-6.1)
* Fixed HTTP port for repo to 8080 (was 8000)
* --baseurl now represents full URL to repo (was baseurl+release)

Closes-Bug: #1454624

commit_message:
Adapt fuel-package-updates to handle metadata only for repos

Summary of changes:
* New option --no-download (-N) to skip downloads
* New option --make-default (-m) to update default repo config
* New distro ubuntu-baseos for handling trusty
* ubuntu-baseos can only be used for metadata, but not download (-N)
* --clear-upstream-repos switch to replace ubuntu* repos with trusty
* added default mirror URLs for ubuntu and centos
* --apply now can use --env or --make-default or both
* Updated release to 2014.2.2-6.1 (was 2014.2-6.1)
* Fixed HTTP port for repo to 8080 (was 8000)
* --baseurl now represents full URL to repo (was baseurl+release)
* Added global vars fuel_ver and openstack_release

Closes-Bug: #1454624
Closes-Bug: #1455159
blueprint package-fuel-components

Change-Id: I3ecdc3dee2675e2c63fc480b77df3e550048e669

commit_message:
Fixing pep8 gate PBR issue

Having the sitepackages declaration in our tox.ini is causing
gate failures due to a PBR package conflict. Removing to resolve
the issue.

Change-Id: Ib9d9c5881ac4857d89bfa7ac0badbbb50984e89f
Closes-Bug: #1456664

commit_message:
Fix doc according to devstack support

Right now, we have templates only vm, we not have baremetal
support now, so I did not doc the baremetal. You can check
template_definition.py for details.

Closes-Bug: #1454591
Change-Id: Ic3bb36bfbdd3a1c68bb40c745db0d38c46f32b86

Magnum depends on Nova, Glance, Heat, and Neutron to create and schedule virtual machines to simulate bare-metal. For milestone #2 we intend to introduce support for Ironic deployment of baremetal nodes.
deleted_lines: DevStack does not yet have Magnum support. It is, however, necessary to develop Magnum from a devstack environment at the present time. Magnum depends on Nova, Heat, and Neutron to create and schedule virtual machines to simulate bare-metal. For milestone #2 we intend to introduce support for Ironic deployment of baremetal nodes.

commit_message:
Restart mcollective at the end of cloud-init magic

We use mcollective cloud-init module to configure
mcollective service. This module runs the command
'service mcollective start' which does nothing
if the service is already running (which is the actual case).
So, we can end up with mcollective unable to see
config file changed made by cloud-init and hence
prevent mcollective from being able to connect to
rabbit.

This patch restarts mcollective at the end of cloud-init run.

Closes-Bug: #1455489
Change-Id: I9ea122acc168120596bf48f378e92874936bcbe1
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-web refs/changes/30/184230/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: {% else %} - /usr/sbin/update-rc.d mcollective defaults - service mcollective restart

subject: Prevent nailgun-agent/cloud-init collision
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-05-18 16:20:52.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/fuel-web/commit/3c658562e5eedec4d9e91dabaf53d79a35626389', 'message': 'Prevent nailgun-agent/clou-init collision

This patch prevent nailgun-agent from doing anything
until cloud-init has finished its magic.

/var/run/nodiscover file is created during provisioning stage
and then it is removed in /etc/rc.local which guarantees
that nailgun-agent will not change mcollective config at the
same time when cloud-init does this. Otherwise, we can
end up with corrupted mcollective config.

Change-Id: If8d1252e6d351ad073de26afc13a19de76f531fb
Closes-Bug: #1449186
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2015-05-18 16:33:14.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/fuel-web/commit/0f1918c1c1973c9db49a669d8a1255ffa5221f68', 'message': 'Prevent nailgun-agent/clou-init collision

This patch prevent nailgun-agent from doing anything
until cloud-init has finished its magic.

/var/run/nodiscover file is created during provisioning stage
and then it is removed in /etc/rc.local which guarantees
that nailgun-agent will not change mcollective config at the
same time when cloud-init does this. Otherwise, we can
end up with corrupted mcollective config.

commit_message:
Prevent nailgun-agent/cloud-init collision

This patch prevents nailgun-agent from doing anything
until cloud-init has finished its magic.

/etc/nailgun-agent/nodiscover file is created during provisioning stage
and then it is removed in /etc/rc.local which guarantees
that nailgun-agent doesn't change mcollective config at the
same time when cloud-init does this. Otherwise, we can
end up with corrupted mcollective config.

Related-Patch: I5fca4ca39abdc273f6958f2643fae6c5c99fba68
Change-Id: If8d1252e6d351ad073de26afc13a19de76f531fb
Closes-Bug: #1449186

added_lines: cloud-init-per instance allow_nailgun_agent /bin/sh -c 'rm -f /var/run/nodiscover'

commit_message:
Removed sync from reboot_nodes

The thing is we reboot nodes one by one
sleeping couple seconds between subsequent reboot RPC calls.
Sometimes we spend quite long time doing this, time
which is enough for one or more nodes to reboot.
We then call sync method (which is absolutely unnecessary)
and cobbler removes all tftp configs and creates them
again. And sometimes a node can not get the config that
makes it stick on boot asking a user to press any key.

Change-Id: I3ac5a887725411abdfbe1209b8e9f986fbb62666
Closes-Bug: #1456247
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-astute refs/changes/98/184098/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Moved nodiscover to /etc/nailgun-agent

We create /etc/nailgun-agent/nodiscover during
provisioning and then this file is assumed to be
removed in /etc/rc.local which guarantees
that nailgun-agent doesn't change mcollective config at the
same time when cloud-init does this. Otherwise, we can
end up with corrupted mcollective config.

Former location of this file /var/run/nodiscover assumes
it is removed at the beginning of the boot process while
we need it to be in place at least until cloud-init
has finished its magic. For details see
http://www.pathname.com/fhs/pub/fhs-2.3.html#VARRUNRUNTIMEVARIABLEDATA

Related-Patch: If8d1252e6d351ad073de26afc13a19de76f531fb
Change-Id: I5fca4ca39abdc273f6958f2643fae6c5c99fba68
Related-Bug: #1449186

added_lines: from subprocess import CalledProcessError, STDOUT output = check_output(zk_shell, stderr=STDOUT) last_line = output.splitlines()[-1] if last_line.find('Node does not exist') != -1: return [] else: return [entry.strip() for entry in last_line.strip('[]').split(',')]
deleted_lines: from subprocess import CalledProcessError output = check_output(zk_shell) return [entry.strip() for entry in output.splitlines()[-1].strip('[]').split(',')]

commit_message:
fix network setup on evacuate

As reported in bug #1430042 when using evacuate + neutron virtual
machines fail to evacuate because of a failure to update port
bindings.  A similar issue applies to FloatingIP setup for
nova-network.

A related fix was proposed in
https://answers.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/nova/+question/257358
and seemed to be fixing users.

This handles things a bit differently in order to more cleanly
use existing code.

Change-Id: Iafa6d2e9eb76ea0389067c939f21ac2181df6f95
Closes-Bug: #1430042

commit_message:
Cleaned up detection of Monasca components.

Fixed api/persister healthchecks, added notification pid watch and some
storm pid watching.

Change-Id: Ic378b64ac86a519f5f218f576ab244553146035e

added_lines: from monasca_setup.detection import find_process_cmdline, watch_processclass MonAPI(monasca_setup.detection.Plugin): """Detect mon_api and setup monitoring.""" """Build the config as a Plugins object and return.""" return dropwizard_health_check('monitoring', 'api', 'http://localhost:8081/healthcheck')class MonNotification(monasca_setup.detection.Plugin): """Detect the Monsaca notification engine and setup some simple checks.""" def _detect(self): """Run detection, set self.available True if the service is detected.""" if find_process_cmdline('monasca-notification') is not None: """Build the config as a Plugins object and return.""" log.info("\tEnabling the Monasca Notification healthcheck") return watch_process(['monasca-notification'], 'monitoring', 'notification', exact_match=False)class MonPersister(monasca_setup.detection.Plugin): """Detect mon_persister and setup monitoring.""" def _detect(self): """Run detection, set self.available True if the service is detected.""" if find_process_cmdline('monasca-persister') is not None: self.available = True def build_config(self): """Build the config as a Plugins object and return.""" log.info("\tEnabling the mon persister healthcheck") return dropwizard_health_check('monitoring', 'persister', 'http://localhost:8091/healthcheck') # todo # log.info("\tEnabling the mon persister metric collection") # http://localhost:8091/metrics def dependencies_installed(self): return True class MonThresh(monasca_setup.detection.Plugin): """Detect the running mon-thresh and monitor.""" def _detect(self): """Run detection, set self.available True if the service is detected.""" if find_process_cmdline('backtype.storm.daemon') is not None: self.available = True def build_config(self): """Build the config as a Plugins object and return.""" log.info("\tWatching the mon-thresh process.") config = monasca_setup.agent_config.Plugins() for process in ['backtype.storm.daemon.nimbus', 'backtype.storm.daemon.supervisor']: if find_process_cmdline(process) is not None: config.merge(watch_process([process], 'monitoring', 'storm', exact_match=False)) return config def dependencies_installed(self): return True def dropwizard_health_check(service, component, url): """Setup a dropwizard heathcheck to be watched by the http_check plugin.""" 'instances': [{'name': "{0}-{1} healthcheck".format(service, component), 'include_content': False, 'dimensions': {'service': service, 'component': component}}]}

Remove unused enable_pacemaker setting from templates

commit_message:
Configure HAProxy, Galera and MongoDB before start

As with RabbitMQ previously, we can hit the same race conditions between
config being written on all nodes vs. pacemaker starting the
services. Configuring the services at least one step earlier than
starting them will allow us to get rid of this race condition.

Change-Id: I78f47dfb82ca8609ed40f784d65ba92db3d411f3

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-05-14 16:18:48.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/commit/4b030ef82a425414aa3bd4d8c0135e31aad06522', 'message': 'Update to reflect puppet-pacemaker changes

Recently puppet-pacemaker has changed in a backward incompatible way, we
need to reflect the changes in TripleO.

This patch also addresses two intermittent issues so that we have a
green CI as much as possible:

* Ordering problem between corosync service and VIP creation.

* MongoDB service starting race condition systemd vs. pacemaker.

commit_message:
Update to reflect puppet-pacemaker changes

Recently puppet-pacemaker has changed in a backward incompatible way, we
need to reflect the changes in TripleO.

This patch also addresses non-deterministic order between corosync
service and VIP creation.

Depends-On: Ia68fee38f99dba18badc07eb0adbc473cfcffdf3
Change-Id: Ia7fe14cfb1401be98b62afeed589bb9f1b8af761
Co-Authored-By: Yanis Guenane <yanis.guenane@enovance.com>

commit_message:
Fix RabbitMQ startup race

The Pacemaker resource agent might have attempted to start the
service when the rabbitmq-env.conf file wasn't written yet, making
it attempt to bind on 0.0.0.0

Co-Authored-By: Jason Guiditta <jguiditt@redhat.com>
Co-Authored-By: Jiri Stransky <jistr@redhat.com>

Change-Id: I081a0bfc6fc3943b8ade71799357022d29317d79

commit_message:
Optimize IptablesManager._find_last_entry

As it turns out calling .strip() thousands of times can be expensive.
I'll defer to security groups and iptables experts to try and find ways
to call the method less often, cache the results, or any other clever
trick.

Moving strip to the return statement speeds up the method by more than
x2.

Change-Id: I7522c6db50c76274bef93e0f0ea6a78d508b7fbe
Related-Bug: #1455675

This patch adds FuelEnvironment resource manager for context cleanup.
This manager removes all Fuel environments for admin user,

There are no managers for another Fuel resources (node, task) added,

Change-Id: I3fed235d8121c547b9495a7b283cf9d62df3a566
'}]
commit_message:
[Fuel] Add Fuel context cleanup

This patch adds FuelEnvironment resource manager for context cleanup.
This manager removes all Fuel environments for admin user,
since Fuel resources are only managed for admin user.

There are no managers for another Fuel resources (node, task) added,
because only environments can be explicitly deleted by fuelclient.

Change-Id: I3fed235d8121c547b9495a7b283cf9d62df3a566

added_lines: class FuelEnvironmentTestCase(test.TestCase): def setUp(self): super(FuelEnvironmentTestCase, self).setUp() self.resource = resources.FuelEnvironment({"id": 42}) self._all_envs = [{"id": 42}, {"id": 43}, {"id": 44}] self.resource._manager = mock.Mock() self.resource._manager().get_all.return_value = self._all_envs def test_id(self): self.assertEqual(42, self.resource.id()) def test_list(self): self.assertEqual(self._all_envs, self.resource.list()) def test_delete(self): self.resource.delete() self.resource._manager().delete_by_id.assert_called_once_with(42) def test_is_deleted(self): self.assertFalse(self.resource.is_deleted()) self._all_envs.remove({"id": 42}) self.assertTrue(self.resource.is_deleted())

commit_message:
Wire in DeploymentSignalTransport global parameter

Allow puppet implementation to optionally select a different transport
for signalling heat - the default CFN_SIGNAL is maintained, but can
now be easily modified - long term we probably want to switch to
signalling via swift and disabling heat-api-cfn in the seed.

Change-Id: I62b939883192d0c0a240a5197630c22b7956bd58

commit_message:
Workflow documentation is now in infra-manual

Replace URLs for workflow documentation to appropriate parts of the
OpenStack Project Infrastructure Manual.

Also update some outdated/obsolete devstack-related URLs.

commit_message:
objects: remove field ListOfEnumField

Commit 1a5dff21daab08499426d118f4dfa3e5dfe26154 introduces
new field ListOfEnumField to handle cpu arch but was never
used.

This commit remove it

Change-Id: I8223e2965df05b6bc762145050cb9a6594f2bf75
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/87/171287/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
deleted_lines: class ListOfEnumField(AutoTypedField): def __init__(self, valid_values=None, **kwargs): self.AUTO_TYPE = List(Enum(valid_values=valid_values)) super(ListOfEnumField, self).__init__(**kwargs) def __repr__(self): valid_values = self._type._element_type._type._valid_values args = { 'nullable': self._nullable, 'default': self._default, } if valid_values: args.update({'valid_values': valid_values}) return '%s(%s)' % (self._type.__class__.__name__, ','.join(['%s=%s' % (k, v) for k, v in args.items()]))

commit_message:
Refactor zabbix module

* Compatibility with granular architecture
* Style fixes

Fuel-CI: disable
Closes-Bug: 1352208
Change-Id: Iff74e08159a7f4121e9395dd4e228d1c19bbdb83
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-library refs/changes/37/170237/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: class zabbix::monitoring::keystone inherits zabbix::params { $enabled = ($role in ['controller', 'primary-controller']) if $enabled { notice("Ceilometer monitoring auto-registration: '${name}'") zabbix_template_link { "${host_name} Template App OpenStack Keystone": host => $host_name, template => 'Template App OpenStack Keystone', api => $api_hash, } zabbix_template_link { "${host_name} Template App OpenStack Keystone API check": host => $host_name, template => 'Template App OpenStack Keystone API check', api => $api_hash, } zabbix::agent::userparameter { 'keystone.api.status': command => "/etc/zabbix/scripts/check_api.py keystone http ${host_ip} 5000"; 'keystone.service.api.status': command => "/etc/zabbix/scripts/check_api.py keystone_service http ${host_ip} 35357"; } } }

commit_message:
Fix ha_pacemaker_configuration()

Pacemaker resources vip__public and ping_vip__public were
re-ordered so they should be checked separatelly.

Change-Id: I14ef37e51d86749cc999424918fc363ea93c21e3
Closes-Bug: #1448950
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-qa refs/changes/18/180218/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: assert_not_equal( re.search("vip__public\s+\(ocf::fuel:ns_IPaddr2\):\s+Started", config) and re.search("Clone Set:\s+clone_ping_vip__public\s+" "\[ping_vip__public\]\s+Started:\s+\[ {0} \]" .format(pcm_nodes), config), None, 'Resource [vip__public] is not properly configured') in config, 'Resource [vip__management] is not properly configured')
deleted_lines: assert_not_equal(re.search( "vip__public\s+\(ocf::fuel:ns_IPaddr2\):\s+Started\s+" "Clone Set:\s+clone_ping_vip__public\s+\[ping_vip__public\]" "\s+Started:\s+\[ {0} \]".format(pcm_nodes), config), None, 'public vip is not configured right') in config, 'vip management is not configured right')

commit_message:
Allow for other then STABLE api version

Add the ability to pass down a tuple of allow=('experimental') from the
adapter all the way down to discovery.

Change-Id: I0e2e2706a00a128aab71ac8e965e33409099ce02

commit_message:
Release Neutron ports after share server deletion using generic driver

Generic driver creates ports in Neutron for each share server but does not
delete it with deletion of share servers. It leads to orphaning of ports and
fixed ip leak. So, write their IDs to share server details and release ports
after share server deletion.

Change-Id: I719c8ece9fcaf9dcc484fb6c522997d2856cc4a3
Closes-Bug: #1453191

added_lines: def check_node(remote, hostname, cmd=None): logger.info("Check {0} existence in the list".format(hostname)) if cmd: node = remote.execute( 'dockerctl shell cobbler bash -c "cobbler system list" | grep {0}'. format(hostname)) else: node = remote.execute('fuel node | grep {0}'.format(hostname)) return int(node['exit_code']) == 0 def check_cluster_presence(cluster_id, postgres_actions): logger.info("Check cluster deletion") try: int((postgres_actions.run_query( db='nailgun', query="select id from clusters where id={0};".format(cluster_id)))) return True except ValueError: return False

fuel-library dev comments, that this case not supported without
implemntation of fencing feature

commit_message:
Deploy and check Dual hypervisors cloud (for rally tests)

Change-Id: I82eddacdf2114c8c91e4392abae7f104ef507041
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-qa refs/changes/39/178239/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: @test(depends_on=[SetupEnvironment.prepare_slaves_5], groups=["vcenter_vlan_dualhv"]) @log_snapshot_on_error def vcenter_vlan_dualhv(self): """Deploy enviroment of vcenter+qemu with nova vlan and CephOSD backend for glance. Scenario: 1. Create cluster with vCenter support 2. Add 3 nodes with controller roles 3. Add a node with Cinder role and ceph-osd 4. Add a node with vCinder role and ceph-osd 5. Set Nova-Network VlanManager as a network backend 6. Deploy the cluster 7. Run network verification 8. Run OSTF """ self.env.revert_snapshot("ready_with_5_slaves") # Configure cluster cluster_id = self.fuel_web.create_cluster( name=self.__class__.__name__, mode=DEPLOYMENT_MODE, vcenter_value={ "glance": { "vcenter_username": "", "datacenter": "", "vcenter_host": "", "vcenter_password": "", "datastore": "", }, "availability_zones": [ {"vcenter_username": VCENTER_USERNAME, "nova_computes": [ {"datastore_regex": ".*", "vsphere_cluster": "Cluster1", "service_name": "vmcluster1"}, {"datastore_regex": ".*", "vsphere_cluster": "Cluster2", "service_name": "vmcluster2"}, ], "vcenter_host": VCENTER_IP, "az_name": "vcenter", "vcenter_password": VCENTER_PASSWORD, }], "network": {"esxi_vlan_interface": "vmnic1"}}, ) logger.info("cluster is {}".format(cluster_id)) # Assign role to nodes self.fuel_web.update_nodes( cluster_id, {'slave-01': ['controller'], 'slave-02': ['controller'], 'slave-03': ['controller'], 'slave-04': ['cinder', 'compute'], 'slave-05': ['cinder-vmware', 'compute'], }) # Configure network interfaces. # Public and Fixed networks are on the same interface # because Nova will use the same vSwitch for PortGroups creating # as a ESXi management interface is located in. interfaces = { 'eth0': ["fuelweb_admin"], 'eth1': ["public", "fixed"], 'eth2': ["management", ], 'eth3': [], 'eth4': ["storage"], } slave_nodes = self.fuel_web.client.list_cluster_nodes(cluster_id) for node in slave_nodes: self.fuel_web.update_node_networks(node['id'], interfaces) # Configure Nova-Network VLanManager. self.fuel_web.update_vlan_network_fixed( cluster_id, amount=8, network_size=32) self.fuel_web.deploy_cluster_wait(cluster_id) self.fuel_web.verify_network(cluster_id) # FIXME when OSTF test will be fixed in bug # # When the bug will be fixed 'should_fail=1' and # 'failed_test_name' parameter should be removed. self.fuel_web.run_ostf( cluster_id=cluster_id, test_sets=['smoke', 'sanity', 'ha'], should_fail=1, failed_test_name=[('Launch instance with file injection')])

commit_message:
Add ManageIQ Botvinnik RC3

Add the ManageIQ Botvinnik RC3 image, a separate entry will be
forthcoming for the current 'stable' release.

Image-URL: http://releases.manageiq.org/manageiq-openstack-botvinnik-1-rc3.qc2
Image-hash: 933baba0d9a362725cb18836df4eb70e
Change-Id: I5c9588f9ddbfcdd42125eaa07fa59913590c20b5
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/app-catalog refs/changes/44/183944/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: - name: ManageIQ Botvinnik RC3 provided_by: name: ManageIQ href: http://www.manageiq.org company: ManageIQ, sponsored by Red Hat description: > Drive your complete virtual infrastructure with ManageIQ. Manage the lifecycle of your applications, place virtual workloads according to your business priorities, and  automatically through policies you set  balance your costs, performance, security, and reliability across cloud platforms. ManageIQ lets you control everything, completely, from one end of a virtual machine lifecycle to the other. ManageIQ is the open source project that powers Red Hat CloudForms. This is the 3rd Release Candidate for the upcoming 'Botvinnik' release. format: QCOW2 attributes: url: http://releases.manageiq.org/manageiq-openstack-botvinnik-1-rc3.qc2 docs: http://manageiq.org/documentation/ releases: http://releases.manageiq.org/ hash: 933baba0d9a362725cb18836df4eb70e

commit_message:
Adding retry ability to heatclient calls

All heatclient calls wrapped in execute_with_retry
method to avoid occasional errors

partially implements bp clients-calls-retry

Change-Id: I835fd79b5783f4a5271cec67b013ba8aeba3091a

added_lines: from sahara.utils.openstack import base as b res_names = b.execute_with_retries( heat.client().resources.get, cluster.name, instance.instance_name).required_by for res_name in res_names: vol_res = b.execute_with_retries( heat.client().resources.get, cluster.name, res_name) b.execute_with_retries(heat.client().stacks.delete, cluster.name)
deleted_lines: res_names = heat.client().resources.get( cluster.name, instance.instance_name).required_by for res_name in res_names: vol_res = heat.client().resources.get(cluster.name, res_name) heat.client().stacks.delete(cluster.name)

commit_message:
Added validation of template names in scenario tests

Sahara checks name of cluster, node group templates, cluster templates.
If we run tests with incorrect names, tests failing. We need check test
names in templates of scenario tests

Change-Id: Ic5bcadbfde9af2f0b9d4a1628951b311abf2c96f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/sahara refs/changes/46/184046/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import six import re import sahara.utils.api_validator as unit_validator "minLength": 1, "format": "valid_name" "minLength": 1, "format": "valid_name" "minLength": 1, "format": "valid_name"@jsonschema.FormatChecker.cls_checks('valid_name') def validate_name_hostname_format(entry): res = re.match(r"^(([a-zA-Z]|[a-zA-Z][a-zA-Z0-9\-]" r"*[a-zA-Z0-9])\.)*([A-Za-z]|[A-Za-z]" r"[A-Za-z0-9\-]*[A-Za-z0-9])$", entry) return res is not None

commit_message:
Enabling Swift client retries

* set number of retries before failure according
  to config value
* enabling retries on ratelimit
* set delay between retries according to
  config value

partially implements bp clients-calls-retry

Change-Id: I432ad9d0a357cbeb094758e1050851ebf7ce21b7
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/sahara refs/changes/08/177708/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

ngReorg - create framework dir

This patch simply renames:

to:

This is one step in a larger effort to restructure the Angular
source. See https://review.openstack.org/#/c/176152/ for the
full set of planned changes.

commit_message:
Re-raise exception in fake threads

Sometimes our tests fail due to exceptions in fake threads. In this case
we handle exceptions, do rollback and raise it again. The behavious is
wrong, because when we raise this exception again the original traceback
is lost. In order to avoid this we have to re-raise exception. In could
be done by replacing "raise e" with just "raise".

Closes-Bug: #1456161

Change-Id: I960fa1b90ddefe1c9f2936ce90758405eb871ef9
Signed-off-by: Igor Kalnitsky <igor@kalnitsky.org>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-web refs/changes/24/184024/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: except Exception: raise
deleted_lines: except Exception as e: raise e

commit_message:
Add CheckRepositoryConnectionFromSlavesTask

This task is being invoked as a subtask of VerifyNetwork task, it uses
calls astute check_repositories method which is introduced in the patch
this change depends on.

Receiverd action is added, to retrieve repository check result from
Astute

Change-Id: If820c72f2024ab18f8c4cd4177d658c1fa41caf3
Partial-Bug: #1439686
Depends-On: Ifb28bd0a53abf07e48d41683d10f90546889b0e4

commit_message:
Add Integration test with multiple cluster for Vcenter

Scenario:
1. Create cluster with vCenter support
2. Add 3 nodes with Controller roles
3. Add 2 nodes with compute role
4. Deploy the cluster
5. Run network verification
6. Run OSTF
7. Create 2 VMs on each of hypervisor
8. Verify that VMs on different hypervisors should communicate
   between each other

Change-Id: Ie098703e0437188ae5701b44d6d76d41face514f
Closes-bug: #1454613
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-qa refs/changes/07/182607/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import time from devops.helpers.helpers import waitfrom fuelweb_test.settings import SERVTEST_USERNAME from fuelweb_test.settings import SERVTEST_PASSWORD from fuelweb_test.settings import SERVTEST_TENANTfrom fuelweb_test.helpers import os_actions from proboscis.asserts import assert_true @test(depends_on=[SetupEnvironment.prepare_slaves_5], groups=["vcenter_multiple_cluster"]) @log_snapshot_on_error def vcenter_multiple_cluster(self): """Deploy environment in DualHypervisors mode \ Check network connection between VM's from different hypervisors. Scenario: 1. Create cluster with vCenter support 2. Add 3 nodes with Controller roles 3. Add 2 nodes with compute role 4. Deploy the cluster 5. Run network verification 6. Run OSTF 7. Create 2 VMs on each of hypervisor 8. Verify that VMs on different hypervisors should communicate between each other Duration 112 min """ self.env.revert_snapshot("ready_with_5_slaves") # Configure cluster cluster_id = self.fuel_web.create_cluster( name=self.__class__.__name__, mode=DEPLOYMENT_MODE, vcenter_value={ "availability_zones": [ {"vcenter_username": VCENTER_USERNAME, "nova_computes": [ {"datastore_regex": ".*", "vsphere_cluster": "Cluster1", "service_name": "vmcluster1" }, {"datastore_regex": ".*", "vsphere_cluster": "Cluster2", "service_name": "vmcluster2" }, ], "vcenter_host": VCENTER_IP, "az_name": "vcenter", "vcenter_password": VCENTER_PASSWORD, }], "network": {"esxi_vlan_interface": "vmnic1"} } ) logger.debug("cluster is {}".format(cluster_id)) # Assign role to node self.fuel_web.update_nodes( cluster_id, {'slave-01': ['controller'], 'slave-02': ['controller'], 'slave-03': ['controller'], 'slave-04': ['compute'], 'slave-05': ['compute']}) self.fuel_web.deploy_cluster_wait(cluster_id) self.fuel_web.run_ostf( cluster_id=cluster_id, test_sets=['smoke', 'sanity', 'ha'], timeout=60 * 60) os_ip = self.fuel_web.get_public_vip(cluster_id) os_conn = os_actions.OpenStackActions( os_ip, SERVTEST_USERNAME, SERVTEST_PASSWORD, SERVTEST_TENANT) # Get list of available images,flavors and hipervisors images_list = os_conn.nova.images.list() flavors_list = os_conn.nova.flavors.list() hypervisors_list = os_conn.get_hypervisors() # Create VMs on each of hypervisor for image in images_list: for i in range(0, len(images_list)): os_conn.nova.servers.create( flavor=flavors_list[0], name='test_{0}_{1}'.format(image.name, i), image=image ) # Wait for launch VMs for hypervisor in hypervisors_list: t1 = time.time() while time.time() < t1 + 300: if os_conn.get_hypervisor_vms_count(hypervisor) != 0: break # Verify that current state of each VMs is Active srv_list = os_conn.get_servers() for srv in srv_list: wait( lambda: os_conn.get_instance_detail(srv).status == "ACTIVE", timeout=100) logger.info( "Current state of Vm is {}".format( os_conn.get_instance_detail(srv).status) ) # Get ip of VMs srv_ip = [] srv_list = os_conn.get_servers() for srv in srv_list: ip = srv.networks[srv.networks.keys()[0]][0] srv_ip.append(ip) # VMs on different hypervisors should communicate between each other for ip_1 in srv_ip: for ip_2 in srv_ip: if ip_1 != ip_2: ssh = self.fuel_web.get_ssh_for_node("slave-01") wait(lambda: not ssh.execute( 'curl -s -m1 http://' + ip_1 + ':22 |grep -iq "[a-z]"')['exit_code'], interval=10, timeout=10 ) # Check server's connectivity res = int(os_conn.execute_through_host( ssh, ip_1, "ping -q -c3 " + ip_2 + "| grep -o '[0-9] packets received' | cut -f1 -d ' '" ) ) assert_true( res == 3, "Error in Instances network connectivity." )

commit_message:
Add a directory for overcloud heat environments

This patch adds a new directory called environments which contains
custom Heat environment files that can be used to enable custom
overcloud features. As an initial example a puppet-ceph-devel.yaml
environment has been added which can be used to spin up a small Ceph
cluster for dev/testing.

This directory may be useful for collecting other
feature related Heat environment settings in the future as well.
Things like isolated network settings, etc.

Change-Id: Ia6998ae05d2363384d2a616a31d5795c8b2d85d5
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/96/183096/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # A Heat environment file which can be used to enable a Ceph # storage cluster using the controller and 2 ceph nodes. # Rbd backends are enabled for Cinder, Glance, and Nova. parameters: CephStorageCount: 2 #NOTE: These ID's and keys should be regenerated for # a production deployment. What is here is suitable for # developer and CI testing only. CephClusterFSID: '4b5c8c0a-ff60-454b-a1b4-9747aa737d19' CephMonKey: 'AQC+Ox1VmEr3BxAALZejqeHj50Nj6wJDvs96OQ==' CephAdminKey: 'AQDLOh1VgEp6FRAAFzT7Zw+Y9V6JJExQAsRnRQ==' NovaEnableRbdBackend: true CinderEnableRbdBackend: true GlanceBackend: rbd CinderEnableIscsiBackend: false ControllerEnableCephStorage: true

commit_message:
Refactor and decompose db_base_plugin_v2.py

- Rebased to the master branch to get the latest fix on tox.ini
  This resolves "ConfigError: substitution key 'envbindir' not found" error
  when running functional testing.
- Added infoblox and openstack license info in the comment section.
- Changed variable names that use camel cases to use low cases with
  underscores in BaseRequestFactory.

Change-Id: Ic8c6484ac13544c91b9ca537c96a5518dfd7fdf2
Partially-Implements: blueprint neutron-ipam

commit_message:
VMware: add support for NFS 4.1

ESX 6.0 supports NFS 4.1. This patch enables NFS 4.1 support.

Closes-bug: #1451834

DocImpact: The driver will now support NFS version 4.1

Change-Id: I31cd846e5c87dc3de46cc2ec17ce062bf0285221

commit_message:
Add controller to deployment critical roles list

Currently if a failure happens on a controller as part of an HA
deployment, the failure is ignored and the deployment continues on the
rest of the nodes. This can lead to errors in the post deployment
phase. One particular instance is when Ceph is being utilized and
we attempt to restart the rados processes on all of the controllers.

In order to prevent errors that may occur in the post deployment
phase, we need to ensure that all actions were successful on all of
the regular controller nodes as well as the primary-controller role.

Change-Id: I466c9f13f373d9a7a5e05e365c173895c87a56a2
Closes-Bug: 1456318
Related-Bug: 1455570

commit_message:
Adjust MTU for child interfaces if it possible

For network scheme, like
---
network_scheme:
  version: 1.1
  provider: lnx
  interfaces:
    eth1:
      mtu: 9000
  transformations:
    - action: add-port
      name: eth1
    - action: add-port
      name: eth1.101
  endpoints:
    eth1.101:
      IP:
        - 192.168.34.56/24
  roles:
    xxx: eth1.101

interface 'eth1.101' should be created with MTU=9000

Closes-bug: #1453027
Change-Id: I170e9088d5e3bcd241da7e56dfa7b7934d6d810d

added_lines: This function gets an properties from transformations trans_name = argv.flatten[0] rv = L23network.get_property_for_transformation(mode, trans_name, lookupvar('l3_fqdn_hostname')) Puppet::debug("get_transformation_property(...): Can't find '#{mode}' value for transformation '#{trans_name}'.") if rv.nil? return rv
deleted_lines: This function gets an endpoint properties from transformations -- cfg = L23network::Scheme.get_config(lookupvar('l3_fqdn_hostname')) if cfg.nil? raise(Puppet::ParseError, "get_transformation_property(...): You must call prepare_network_config(...) first!") end if !cfg[:roles] || !cfg[:endpoints] || cfg[:roles].class.to_s() != "Hash" || cfg[:endpoints].class.to_s() != "Hash" raise(Puppet::ParseError, "get_transformation_property(...): Invalid cfg_hash format.") end transforms = cfg[:transformations] ifaces = cfg[:interfaces] all_ifaces = ifaces.keys.map(&:to_s) devices = argv.flatten mtu = [] rv = nil case mode when 'MTU' devices.each do |device| if all_ifaces.include? device and ifaces[device.to_sym][:mtu] != nil mtu.push(ifaces[device.to_sym][:mtu]) else for i in 0..transforms.size-1 do transform = cfg[:transformations][i] if transform[:name] == device and transform[:mtu] != nil mtu.push(transform[:mtu]) end end end if mtu.empty? Puppet::debug("get_transformation_property(...): MTU value is not set for interface '#{device}'.") rv = nil else rv = mtu.min end end end rv

commit_message:
Replace dict.itervalues() with six.itervalues(dict)

The Python 2 itervalues() method of dictionaries was renamed to values()
in Python 3. Replace dict.itervalues() with six.itervalues(dict) to get
code working on Python 2 and Python 3.

This patch was generated by the following tool (revision fcbf8ad0ec7a)
with the "itervalues" operation:
https://bitbucket.org/haypo/misc/src/tip/python/sixer.py

Blueprint nova-python3
Change-Id: Ied9a76447fbdc933369f926cb19aab9d8896ab92

commit_message:
Python 3: sort tables by their full name

Sort SQLAlchemy tables by their full names using a key functions when
calling sorted(tables).

On Python 3, sqlalchemy.Table instances are no more comparable.

Change-Id: I38ca49d8685121f04ed9b8cebaecea230b7713dc
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ceilometer refs/changes/92/183592/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: for i in sorted(tables, key=lambda table: table.fullname):

commit_message:
Grammar/phrasal mistakes: OS Virtual Machine Image Guide

* Grammar mistakes corrected.
* Not all corrections in the bug were made as it changed the meaning
and/or were grammatically incorrect themselves.
* Fix incorrect links

Closes-bug: #1387850

commit_message:
Python 3: replace long with int

* Replace 123L with 123: "123L" is a syntax error on Python 3
* Replace long() with int()
* Replace (int, long) with six.integer_types
* Make long type conditional in META_TYPE_MAP
  (ceilometer/storage/sqlalchemy/utils.py)

commit_message:
Removing sleep between when a command is sent and 'YES' is sent

Removing sleep between when a command is sent and 'YES' is sent to
confirm the operation. We believe it is added because the Cisco CLI
is mirrored based on Brocade. Removing would increase performance when
launching concurrent vms.

Closes-Bug: #1447776

Change-Id: I3102922456fa9dde3a63ec623565a3427e9b357d

commit_message:
Improve websso documentation.

Fix a mismatched <Location> and </LocationMatch> tag in the example
config snippet, and mention that the config should match the identity
provider Location config.

Change-Id: I7dc957d2ccdcc38f2eba305bf857e9449f6a5856
Closes-Bug: #1452197

commit_message:
Cleaning up debug messages from previous change in vmops.py

In the previous change I29c89e9a17f9a170dbe61e4fe14672d481c4fb78
the debug text could be confusing and dangerous. I've gone ahead
and changed these values to make them less confusing to others.

Change-Id: I88c9322fbecb96b6fe3cf0a1ae91e09d2453e93f

commit_message:
keystone_service resource using api Version 3

  - Uses _type_, not the _name_ for resource creation
  - OSC Service list does not use the --long argument
  - Destroy and update (set) now uses resource ID rather its name.
  - Offers backward compatibility as much as possible.

Change-Id: Iea277a518d11ecf1ba2d80769e9c02699a90ac40
Implements: blueprint api-v3-support
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-keystone refs/changes/89/183989/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: require 'puppet/provider/openstack/api' @api = Puppet::Provider::Openstack::API.new('3') properties = ['--name', resource[:name]] if resource[:type] if resource[:description] properties << '--description' properties << resource[:description] end request('service', 'create', resource[:type], properties) @property_hash[:ensure] = :present else raise(Puppet::Error, 'The type is mandatory for creating a keystone service') end def exists? @property_hash[:ensure] == :present def description=(value) @property_flush[:description] = value def type=(value) @property_flush[:type] = value end (options << "--description=#{resource[:description]}") if @property_flush[:description] (options << "--type=#{resource[:type]}") if @property_flush[:type] request('service', 'set', @instance[:id], resource[:auth], options) unless options.empty?
deleted_lines: properties = ['--name'] properties << resource[:name] if resource[:description] properties << '--description' properties << resource[:description] end raise(Puppet::Error, 'The service type is mandatory') unless resource[:type] properties << resource[:type] self.class.request('service', 'create', properties) @property_hash[:ensure] = :present end def exists? @property_hash[:ensure] == :present def description=(value) @property_flush[:description] = value def type=(value) @property_flush[:type] = value destroy create

subject: Set conductor use_local flag in compute manager tests
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-03-24 11:46:24.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/compute/test_compute_mgr.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/ed2c7a607a5fe7bb71ef574e4bc3cfb8920ddd47', 'message': 'Set conductor use_local flag in compute manager tests

Some compute manager tests that exercise the exception behavior of
methods combined with using a somewhat real instance parameter when
doing so take very long time to complete(>60s). This happens if the
method being tested has the @revert_task_state decorator because it
will try to update the instance using a conductor call when there is
no conductor service listening.

By setting the use_local flag, these tests no longer experience such
timeouts and total test time is reduced by minutes.

Change-Id: I4f5272f5b39d53ad7e868cc8c91a793851ab4387
Closes-Bug: #1435803
'}]
commit_message:
Set conductor use_local flag in compute manager tests

Some compute manager tests that exercise the exception behavior of
methods combined with using a somewhat real instance parameter when
doing so take very long time to complete(>60s). This happens if the
method being tested has the @revert_task_state decorator because it
will try to update the instance using a conductor call when there is
no conductor service listening.

By setting the use_local flag, these tests no longer experience such
timeouts and total test time is reduced by minutes.

Change-Id: I4f5272f5b39d53ad7e868cc8c91a793851ab4387
Closes-Bug: #1435803
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/84/167184/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: self.flags(use_local=True, group='conductor')

commit_message:
Restrict pbr to version < 1.0

pbr 1.0 was released. The release broke the nova pep8 gate because
flake8 requires pbr < 1.0, whereas nova installs pbr 1.0.

Closes-Bug: #1456362
Depends-On: I4481b03f282e2092e259caa3599e5f773f7ee9af
Change-Id: I2aaf8af57ab59047bc34611a3baa00305238c98f

added_lines: from keystoneclient.exceptions import ClientException self.keystone = self._get_keystoneclient(username=user, password=password, tenant_name=tenant, auth_url=auth_url) def _get_keystoneclient(username, password, tenant_name, auth_url, retries=3): keystone = None for i in range(retries): try: keystone = keystoneclient(username=username, password=password, tenant_name=tenant_name, auth_url=auth_url) except ClientException as e: err = "Try nr {0}. Could not get keystone client, error: {1}" LOGGER.warning(err.format(i + 1, e)) time.sleep(5) if not keystone: raise return keystone

commit_message:
Make hacking-python34 gating

The job has been running successfully for a while, and we want to ensure
python 3 compatibility, so make it voting.

Python3 jobs template already includes the python34 unit test job.

Change-Id: I35b6dd4f12ef757ab2a2ed7422023858084a8154

commit_message:
support for keystone v3 api - allow v2 or v3 providers

- This patch implements blueprint part 1)

  Using Puppet::Provider::Openstack::API object to create a class variable
  allowing providers supporting v3 to override the class variable with '3' value

  Default is API Version 2.0:
  @api = Puppet::Provider::Openstack::API.new('2.0')

Change-Id: I6cd6a3a5bd206bc4495ab1b7c236c7e3fbd11f4a
Implements: blueprint api-v3-support

commit_message:
Refactor and decompose db_base_plugin_v2.py

- Rebased to the master branch to get the latest fix on tox.ini
  This resolves "ConfigError: substitution key 'envbindir' not found" error
  when running functional testing.
- Added infoblox and openstack license info in the comment section.
- Changed variable names that use camel cases to use low cases with
  underscores in BaseRequestFactory.

Change-Id: I1096568456fe306a0d0714405d4b10bb4c370f59

commit_message:
Fix a bug in cluster test case

Sometimes, the *os.heat.stack* profile can't be registered correctly
when EngineService is initialized. This error happened occasionally
when doing test case. This patch temporarily replaces usage of
*os.heat.stack* profile type in cluster test cases with a fake
profile type to prevent this bug happening since it's now blocking
all verifications.

TODO:
 - Need to check the detail reason of this bug later.

Change-Id: I1d3b49001bd1cc8b0be5f91b87ae2f726d4cead4
Closes-Bug: #1452604

commit_message:
Bump up keepalive_interval and keepalive_count in qemu.conf

Logs indicate that the keepalive mechanism may be timing out,
let's double both parameters to bump up the timeout.

Partial-Bug: #1451506
Change-Id: I5ff594a85b1062e0d789faccc1b60229af608144

added_lines: # Bump up both keepalive_interval and keepalive_count from 5 to 10 # cat <<EOF | sudo tee -a $QEMU_CONF keepalive_interval = 10 keepalive_count = 10 EOF

subject: Bump pbr cap to <2.0
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-05-19 00:32:07.000000000', 'files': ['requirements.txt'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/hacking/commit/bc4b1118e155784bc306c01733375ffec56b89b3', 'message': "Bump pbr cap to <2.0

commit_message:
Bump pbr cap to <2.0

Hacking's pbr cap of <1.0 is breaking things (see bug for a lot more
detail). Trunk hacking has already moved to the new pbr cap, but it
there is a backwards incompatible change on trunk
(I819d2069f169cabd1fcf333057a80790678e3745) that prevents us from
releasing 0.10.2 from there. So I created a 0.10.x branch and am
changing the pbr requirement here so that we can cut hacking 0.10.2 to
fix the bug.

Change-Id: I77f2b7e661c4de067e39596765d36a4463a2d143
Closes-Bug: #1456376

commit_message:
Bug 1456376: Lock pbr < 1.0 for now

See the bug for details, but flake8 is doing runtime checks for
co-installability, and this fails as many projects still have a pbr
<1.0 install_requires: but g-r controls the versions installed due to
pip bug 988.

Change-Id: I4481b03f282e2092e259caa3599e5f773f7ee9af
Partial-Bug: 1456376

commit_message:
Bump pbr versions.

We're about to release pbr 1.0. This needs to be permitted :). Also
anything < 0.10 was totally broken with PEP-440 in pip, so we have
to bump the lower end. Since we're bumping it, bring everything in
line with the current release - which we gate on everywere anyway
because setup_requires is unversioned.

Change-Id: Ia7205b4599ae648cdb4935111458d92f2065b47e

commit_message:
Bump pbr versions.

We're about to release pbr 1.0. This needs to be permitted :). Also
anything < 0.10 was totally broken with PEP-440 in pip, so we have
to bump the lower end. Since we're bumping it, bring everything in
line with the current release - which we gate on everywere anyway
because setup_requires is unversioned.

Change-Id: Ia7205b4599ae648cdb4935111458d92f2065b47e

commit_message:
Add vagrant nodeset and make it the default

Added an Ubuntu nodeset stolen from the puppetlabs apache module.
The box_url is necessary even though the box is namespaced, vagrant
seems to have changed recently and just having the vagrant cloud
namespace in the box name is not enough to import the box.

We're making this nodeset the default so that a developer can have
it "just work" on their laptop. CI will be configured to use a
nodepool nodeset. Following the example of the puppetlabs modules,
the default nodeset is a copy of the new ubuntu nodeset so that
setting BEAKER_set=ubuntu-server-1404-x64 still works.

Fixed an error in the README (correct environment variable is
BEAKER_set not BEAKER_setfile) and added more details.

Change-Id: Ib3e50ffbaf613dd2e6582904efeff1d7cce77bb5

commit_message:
Allow libvirt secret key setting from param

Currently the libvirt secret key is demanded to the ceph cluster
via the $(ceph auth get-key ...) command which requires the ceph
cluste to be already up and also assumes the computes are provisioned
with the client.admin keyring.

With this change we add a libvirt_rbd_secret_key parameter which,
if passed, is used instead so that computes can be configured
without the distribution of additional keys.

Change-Id: I70da06159c0d3c6fa204b5f7a468909ffab4d633
Closes-Bug: #1439949
(cherry picked from commit a8ba5a41cdbcbc5b4123cc97e0e46f4c7702b8fa)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-nova refs/changes/79/179679/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: context 'when using cephx and passing libvirt_rbd_secret_key' do before :each do params.merge!( :libvirt_rbd_secret_uuid => 'UUID', :libvirt_rbd_secret_key => 'LIBVIRT/SECRET/KEY', ) end it 'set libvirt secret key from passed key' do should contain_exec('set-secret-value virsh').with( :command => "/usr/bin/virsh secret-set-value --secret #{params[:libvirt_rbd_secret_uuid]} --base64 #{params[:libvirt_rbd_secret_key]}" ) end end

commit_message:
Fix behaviour of 'set-secret-value virsh' exec

Aims at fixing two issues: we had an unless clause which was only
checking if the secret was already defined, not if the value for
the secret was set; when providing the value for the secret, we
were mistakenly referring to the secret by its XML dump instead of
its UUID.

Change-Id: I513599735e974c07a6a0e46fd319930740f259cc
Closes-Bug: #1425601
(cherry picked from commit c44f7f023fb80cac0bda52a038cb2f8d33ac4e8e)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-nova refs/changes/78/179678/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: :command => "/usr/bin/virsh secret-set-value --secret UUID --base64 $(ceph auth get-key client.rbd_test)"

commit_message:
Allow libvirt secret key setting from param

Currently the libvirt secret key is demanded to the ceph cluster
via the $(ceph auth get-key ...) command which requires the ceph
cluste to be already up and also assumes the computes are provisioned
with the client.admin keyring.

With this change we add a libvirt_rbd_secret_key parameter which,
if passed, is used instead so that computes can be configured
without the distribution of additional keys.

Change-Id: I70da06159c0d3c6fa204b5f7a468909ffab4d633
Closes-Bug: #1439949
(cherry picked from commit a8ba5a41cdbcbc5b4123cc97e0e46f4c7702b8fa)

commit_message:
Enable arp_accept for interfaces

This commit enables arp_accept for all interfaces
in order for nodes to be able to accept gratuitous
ARP requests when failover happens.

Change-Id: I499c7fa671d522854b803ed86907f06412e6e1ef
Closes-bug: #1456272

commit_message:
Get management partition (vm.get_mgmt_partition)

Implement a helper method to return the LPAR wrapper representing the
host's management partition.

This is needed for such operations as snapshot, which will need to map
a (normal) instance's storage to the management partition.

Change-Id: I0fb3f8e9191289b4778d4d7171547475dc6bcca5

added_lines: from nova.i18n import _, _LI, _LEdef get_mgmt_partition(adapter): """Get the LPAR wrapper for this host's management partition. :param adapter: The adapter for the pypowervm API. """ wraps = pvm_lpar.LPAR.search(adapter, is_mgmt_partition=True) if len(wraps) != 1: raise Exception(_("Unable to find a single management partition.")) return wraps[0]

commit_message:
Always decode command-line arguments as UTF-8

There was always an implicit assumption that they were UTF-8 before, and
by converting them to unicode we close another hole allowing raw bytes
to appear in user-facing messages.

Change-Id: I88c06c5db835c8b56f269ab20fa279351bf4c70f

commit_message:
Return cell info dictionary instead of cell object.

cell_get() method returns Cell Object that cannot be dumped to
JSON. Also other get methods return cell info dictionary instead
of an object. To keep flow consistent and to get rid of ValueError
exception, changed cell_get() method to return cell info dictionary.

Change-Id: I236246f347460686bdead94e54db25c32698225b
Closes-Bug: #1312002

commit_message:
Python 3: generalize the usage of the six module

* Replace itertools.ifilter() with six.moves.filter()
* Replace itertools.imap() with six.moves.map()
* Replace map(_compare, statistics)
  with [_compare(statistic) for statistic in statistics]
* Replace obj.iterkeys() with six.iterkeys(obj)
* Replace obj.iteritems() with six.iteritems(obj)
* Replace xrange() with six.moves.xrange(), or with range() for small
  ranges
* Replace the repr module with six.moves.reprlib

Change-Id: Iaaa328cc15355182bde444a1aeaa4385691c8f90

commit_message:
Use the recommended default for horizon default dashboards

Let horizon discover the default
dashboards via the INSTALL_APPS (which is already an attribute).
The patch removes the old hardcoded defaults which are no longer
needed nor recommmended.

Change-Id: I3c73756a6d834a9bae69ae6ead235e01cc747593
Closes-Bug: #1455063

commit_message:
Python 3: set __bool__() method on Namespace

The Python 2 __nonzero__() method was renamed to __bool__() in Python 3.

Create a __bool__ alias to __nonzero__ in the Namespace class.

Change-Id: I2ad3b3522b9ee2d33a5eee8886ee5f07776fb449
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ceilometer refs/changes/95/183595/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

subject: support for keystone v3 api - allow v2 or v3 providers
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-04-28 20:13:18.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/puppet-keystone/commit/1e1b6362844aa51191618622f8d7f69b193fe099', 'message': 'support for keystone v3 api - allow v2 or v3 providers

Implements: blueprint api-v3-support

This patch implements these parts of the blueprint:
1) Allows the providers to use the v2 or v3 identity api.  The
keystone.rb provider provides these methods:
a) self.get_api_version_for_url - this is the version suffix to use
for the authentication endpoint.  By default it is "v2.0".  Providers
that support the v3 api should override this method to return "v3".
b) self.get_api_version_for_cmd - this is the api version provided
to the openstack command as --os-identity-api-version.  By default
this function returns [] the empty array which tells openstack to
use the version 2 default.  Providers that support the v3 api should
override this method to return ["--os-identity-api-version", "3"].

commit_message:
support for keystone v3 api - allow v2 or v3 providers

This patch implements these parts of the blueprint:
1) Allows the providers to use the v2 or v3 identity api.

The keystone.rb provider provides these methods:
a) self.get_api_version_for_url - this is the version suffix to use
for the authentication endpoint.  By default it is "v2.0".  Providers
that support the v3 api should override this method to return "v3".

b) self.get_api_version_for_cmd - this is the api version provided
to the openstack command as --os-identity-api-version.  By default
this function returns [] the empty array which tells openstack to
use the version 2 default.  Providers that support the v3 api should
override this method to return ["--os-identity-api-version", "3"].

Implements: blueprint api-v3-support

Change-Id: I6faf88e1f59a50d451356b2f4cab275178c47047

commit_message:
Remove redundancy in ArchivePoliciesController tests

Except for aggregation related tests, duplicate /v1/archive_policy
related tests from test_rest into gabbi tests to remove redundancy.

The initial plan was to just remove tests from test_rest that had
duplicates under gabbi, but it was easier to reconcile into one
source of authority.

Note the addition of two xfail-ing tests in archive.yaml. These fail
on python3 but not python2. The issue is in pecan as described in
the linked bug report.

Change-Id: I4a9d9f1f2a1ced072f91263bf8e819cc798b123a

"somenewname", "definition": "foobar"}, status=400) self.assertIn(b'Invalid input: expected a list ' b'for dictionary value @ data[' + repr(u'definition').encode('ascii') + b"]", result.body) def test_post_archive_already_exists(self): with self.app.use_admin_user(): result = self.app.post_json( "/v1/archive_policy", params={"name": "high", "definition": [{ "granularity": "10s", "points": 20, }]}, status=409) self.assertIn('Archive policy high already exists', result.text) def test_create_archive_policy_with_granularity_integer(self): params = {"name": str(uuid.uuid4()), "back_window": 0, "definition": [{ "granularity": 10, "points": 20, }]} with self.app.use_admin_user(): result = self.app.post_json( "/v1/archive_policy", params=params, status=201) ap = json.loads(result.text) params['definition'][0]['timespan'] = u'0:03:20' params['definition'][0]['granularity'] = u'0:00:10' self.assertEqual( set(self.conf.archive_policy.default_aggregation_methods), set(ap['aggregation_methods'])) del ap['aggregation_methods'] self.assertEqual(params, ap) def test_create_archive_policy_with_back_window(self): params = {"name": str(uuid.uuid4()), "back_window": 1, "definition": [{ "granularity": "10s", "points": 20, }]} with self.app.use_admin_user(): result = self.app.post_json( "/v1/archive_policy", params=params, status=201) ap = json.loads(result.text) params['definition'][0]['timespan'] = u'0:03:20' params['definition'][0]['granularity'] = u'0:00:10' self.assertEqual( set(self.conf.archive_policy.default_aggregation_methods), set(ap['aggregation_methods'])) del ap['aggregation_methods'] self.assertEqual(params, ap) def test_delete_archive_policy(self): params = {"name": str(uuid.uuid4()), "back_window": 1, "definition": [{ "granularity": "10s", "points": 20, }]} with self.app.use_admin_user(): self.app.post_json( "/v1/archive_policy", params=params) self.app.delete("/v1/archive_policy/%s" % params['name'], status=204) def test_delete_archive_policy_non_existent(self): ap = str(uuid.uuid4()) with self.app.use_admin_user(): result = self.app.delete("/v1/archive_policy/%s" % ap, status=404) self.assertIn( b"Archive policy " + ap.encode('ascii') + b" does not exist", result.body) def test_delete_archive_policy_in_use(self): ap = str(uuid.uuid4()) params = {"name": ap, "back_window": 1, "definition": [{ "granularity": "10s", "points": 20, }]} with self.app.use_admin_user(): self.app.post_json( "/v1/archive_policy", params=params) self.app.post_json("/v1/metric", params={"archive_policy_name": ap}) with self.app.use_admin_user(): result = self.app.delete("/v1/archive_policy/%s" % ap, status=400) self.assertIn( b"Archive policy " + ap.encode('ascii') + b" is still in use", result.body) def test_get_archive_policy_non_existent(self): with self.app.use_admin_user(): self.app.get("/v1/archive_policy/" + str(uuid.uuid4()), status=404)

commit_message:
Python 3: Replace unicode with six.text_type

This patch was generated by the sixer tool using the unicode operation:
https://pypi.python.org/pypi/sixer

Manual change:

* Revert change in a docstring in ceilometer/api/controllers/v2/utils.py to
  workaround a bug in the sixer tool

Change-Id: I87f6918212bc3a2cc7232e941cab8b6745fcb688

commit_message:
Update Python 3 requirements

* Remove requirements-py3.txt: it's not more needed, all libraries in
  requirements.txt are compatible with Python 3
* Synchronize test-requirements-py3.txt with test-requirements.txt, add:

  - gabbi
  - psycopg2
  - pylint
  - requests-aws

* Update tox.ini to use requirements.txt instead of requirements-py3.txt

Change-Id: I7c89313663849165e985ae2dac6e05251d003f66

commit_message:
Explicitly check for added/rem'vd metadata entries

Utilize the same methodology as test_volume_metadata and only check
for presence or absence of metadata entries explicitily touched on
the snapshot.

Change-Id: I1b13a14e0572a3cad77973dd077a39ae356e252a
Closes-Bug: 1455182

subject: Fix get_monitor function and local vars for rabbit OCF
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-05-18 14:05:03.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/fuel-library/commit/5d214961111363b2d4554d0b1bf445112f930d9c', 'message': 'Fix local/undef var for rabbit OCF

W/o this fix some variables are missing the local
declaration and might be reused in another places
leading to unpredictable results. For example,
there is the nodelist var should be local as it is
used both action_notify(), get_monitor().

The solution is to fix missing local declarations
for variables and remove unused ones as well.

Closes-bug: #1455761

Change-Id: Iba5e9d984083acea1392cad0abd6453f5d6fbf8b
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobrelia@mirantis.com>
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2015-05-18 14:10:34.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/fuel-library/commit/826d23305f8a71487f2fd5e747d8144bd1facfd9', 'message': 'Fix local/undef var for rabbit OCF

W/o this fix some variables are missing the local
declaration and might be reused in another places
leading to unpredictable results. For example,
there is the nodelist var should be local as it is
used both action_notify(), get_monitor().

The solution is to fix missing local declarations
for variables and remove unused ones as well.

Closes-bug: #1455761

Change-Id: Iba5e9d984083acea1392cad0abd6453f5d6fbf8b
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobrelia@mirantis.com>
'}, {'number': 3, 'created': '2015-05-18 15:56:23.000000000', 'files': ['deployment/puppet/cluster/files/ocf/rabbitmq'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/fuel-library/commit/454a1485453919756b8a4e3083fb71b0928158ec', 'message': 'Fix get_monitor function and local vars for rabbit OCF

W/o this fix:
* get_monitor() does not handle the case then rabbit
app is running and reports $OCF_RUNNING. This makes
the resource to stuck in semi-started state for ever.
* get_monitor() does not always record in logs when
sets master score 0 to ensure the slave does not get
promoted. This makes logging patterns not consistent.
* get_monitor() has two exit point for generic error case
instead of one. This makes logging patterns not consistent.
* some variables are missing the local

leading to unpredictable results. For example,
there is the nodelist var should be local as it is
used both action_notify(), get_monitor().

The solution is:
* fix missing local declarations for variables and
remove unused ones as well.
* add missing log record for "ensuring this slave does
not get promoted."
* handle the get_monitor() case when rabbit app is not
running as appropriate and report $OCF_NOT_RUNNING.
* make the single get_monitor() return point for the
$OCF_ERR_GENERIC case.

Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobrelia@mirantis.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Fix get_monitor function and local vars for rabbit OCF

W/o this fix:
* get_monitor() does not handle the case then rabbit
app is running and reports $OCF_RUNNING. This makes
the resource to stuck in semi-started state for ever.
* get_monitor() does not always record in logs when
sets master score 0 to ensure the slave does not get
promoted. This makes logging patterns not consistent.
* get_monitor() has two exit point for generic error case
instead of one. This makes logging patterns not consistent.
* some variables are missing the local
declaration and might be reused in another places
leading to unpredictable results. For example,
there is the nodelist var should be local as it is
used both action_notify(), get_monitor().

The solution is:
* fix missing local declarations for variables and
remove unused ones as well.
* add missing log record for "ensuring this slave does
not get promoted."
* handle the get_monitor() case when rabbit app is not
running as appropriate and report $OCF_NOT_RUNNING.
* make the single get_monitor() return point for the
$OCF_ERR_GENERIC case.

Closes-bug: #1455761

Change-Id: Iba5e9d984083acea1392cad0abd6453f5d6fbf8b
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobrelia@mirantis.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-library refs/changes/70/184070/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: local tries=5 local string="$*" local a local rabbit_running local nodelist local prev_rc local max local our_uptime local node_uptime local node_start_time local nodelist
deleted_lines: tries=5 string="$*" local msg local master_node local pid local pid

commit_message:
Abort failed cherry-pick and reverts

If a temprevert or cherry-pick fails then we abort the
operation. We were doing something similar in the
temprevert function but this is cleaner and now both
functions are consistent.

Change-Id: I8c72cc7a2e1bc6d47f42e6a27b1c372058342253
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-ci refs/changes/40/173940/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: git reset --hard HEAD # Do this incase the cherry-pick fails (hopefully because its not needed)

commit_message:
Puppet: don't manage /etc/hosts via cloud-init

We don't want cloud-init manage /etc/hosts for the puppet jobs (it
prevents Corosync from setting up a cluster using hostnames), but we
need to keep it in the non-puppet jobs to have them pass.

Change-Id: Idb9ad017ffb1048f38fedbd55cc974785f6b1c38
Partial-Bug: #1447497
Depends-On: Ia8582883f737548e2911d3f36a1943e5b236281b
Depends-On: Iec5b6450c5730c081c8f2ca4d6c9786b956c87d5

commit_message:
storage: bases of a Cassandra driver

This is a basic implementation of a Cassandra driver. For now, it only
supports storing samples collected into a Cassandra column family.

Blueprint: cassandra-driver

Change-Id: I3ef827b069e578b664c483050c4b13e5d95f1f9b

commit_message:
Set pipefail when running tsfilter

The timestamp filter function pipes commands through awk to add
timestamps to those commands. We are interested in preserving the return
codes of those commands which requires pipefail. Set pipefail before
piping through awk then reset the old pipefail value after running
through awk.

Change-Id: I4e0ae2530669ec065a6cb78446cd27449beaeba9
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack-gate refs/changes/37/178437/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Determine what existing pipefail value is so we can reset it after # running the awk filter. Note that $- does not seem to reflect # pipefail so use false | true to tell us if pipefail is enabled. local set_options='-o pipefail' if false | true ; then set_options='+o pipefail' fi set -o pipefail set $set_options

commit_message:
Add UEFI support to ISO

* In UEFI bootloader is grub, not syslinux
* Removed mkisofs
* Removed isohybrid
* Add xorriso

Change-Id: I9158e939f388ef2000f898de4aed7f251202f6bd
Closes-Bug: #1433521
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-main refs/changes/86/173986/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: echo "partition /boot/efi --onpart=/dev/${bootdev}2" >> /tmp/partition.ksecho "bootloader --location=partition --driveorder=${tgtdrive} --append=' biosdevname=0 crashkernel=none'" > /tmp/bootloader.ks

commit_message:
colorize osbash scripts using lib-color.sh

It colorizes the output of osbash.sh using
the conventions given in lib-color.sh.

Implements: blueprint osbash-color-support
Closes-Bug: #1443136
Change-Id: I42ca96454fdab47b283222e2deaf3e9b51d03106
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/training-guides refs/changes/58/177658/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: echo -e >&2 "${CError:-}Neither md5sum nor md5 found. Aborting.${CReset:-}" echo -e >&2 "${CError:-}Verification failed. ISO image is corrupt.${CReset:-}" echo -e >&2 "${CMissing:-}Either ISO URL or name needed (ISO_URL, INSTALL_ISO).${CReset:-}" echo >&2 -e "${CInfo:-}Install ISO:\n\t${CData:-}$INSTALL_ISO${CReset:-}" echo -e >&2 "${CStatus:-}Base disk created${CReset:-}"
deleted_lines: echo >&2 "Neither md5sum nor md5 found. Aborting." echo >&2 "Verification failed. ISO image is corrupt." echo >&2 "Either ISO URL or name needed (ISO_URL, INSTALL_ISO)." echo >&2 -e "Install ISO:\n\t$INSTALL_ISO" echo >&2 "Base disk created"

commit_message:
Add OpenStack logo in the footer

- add small transparent OpenStack logo in the slide footer
- logo and footer design is from OpenStack's
  OpenStackPowered-April2015.ppt master slides
- white background changed to transparent
- logo is pushed back with z-index: -2 (so it is behind background pic
  in the title slide)

Change-Id: Iccdd9a968816f00dde60230df45c5a21d212d38e
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/training-guides refs/changes/45/181445/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

of None.

commit_message:
Allow admins to query user keypairs and create new on their behalf

Add admin-query-any-keypair.rst

APIImpact: New parameter to os-keypairs index and create
Co-Authored-By: Dan Smith <dansmith@redhat.com>
Change-Id: Idd9b8e97c728127a40fdbefe623d1d8b520f9ed5
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova-specs refs/changes/79/175579/11 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ================================================ Allow admins to query keypairs owned by any user ================================================ https://blueprints.launchpad.net/nova/+spec/admin-query-any-keypair This change simply allows admin users to query keypairs owned by users other than themselves. Problem description =================== Currently, keypairs are only available to their owners. Admins should be able to see the keypairs of other users, when needed. Use Cases ---------- As the admin of an openstack cluster I need to see what keypairs a user has. Project Priority ----------------- (yet to be defined) Proposed change =============== This change doesn't affect the API format or schema in any way, but merely adds a query key to select a specific user for the keypair query. The following is a request currently allowed: GET /os-keypairs/ After this change, admins would be able to do this: GET /os-keypairs/?user_id=foobar Alternatives ------------ We could add a new admin API method to facilitate this, but doing so would be a lot more work for little (if any) benefit. Data model impact ----------------- None. REST API impact --------------- * Specification for the method * The existing index operation for keypairs will be extended to honor an optional "user_id" parameter. * Method type: GET * Normal http response code(s): 200 * Expected error http response code(s) * 403: If the user is not an admin * ``/v2.1/ {tenant_id} /os-keypairs?user_id= {user_id} `` * Parameters which can be passed via the url: The alternate user id * JSON schema definition for the body data is unchanged * JSON schema definition for the response data is unchanged * Example use case: Request: GET http://127.0.0.1:8774/v2.1/e0c1f4c0b9444fa086fa13881798144f/os-keypairs?user_id=foo * There should not be any impacts to policy.json files for this change Security impact --------------- Admin users will be able to see the public keys of other users. However, these are generally regarded as material suitable for public viewing anyway. Notifications impact -------------------- None Other end user impact --------------------- * This change will imply changes to the python-novaclient to allow specifying the user for which keypairs should be listed. Performance Impact ------------------ None Other deployer impact --------------------- None Developer impact ---------------- None Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: danms Other contributors: Dan Radez Work Items ---------- * Add a new microversion and make os-keypairs honor the user_id query parameter Dependencies ============ None Testing ======= Unit tests are sufficient for this extremely simple change. Documentation Impact ==================== The nova/api/openstack/rest_api_version_history.rst document will be updated. References ========== * Bug https://bugs.launchpad.net/nova/+bug/1182965 requesting this feature.

commit_message:
Provide a longer timeout for HA scenario

HA Scenarios (3 controllers + 1 Node) may require more than 35 minutes
to run, hence increase the scenario timeout.

Change-Id: Ia68fee38f99dba18badc07eb0adbc473cfcffdf3

commit_message:
Dell: Added support for update_migrated_volume

Added support for updated_migrated_volume to common driver.
Added rename_volume to dell_storagecenter_api to support it.
Added tests to test_dellsc.py and test_dellapi.py.

The only thing we do in this rename the newly migrated volume
destination volume on the Dell Storage center to be the same
as the original volume ID.  Since we identify the volumes
by volume ID this prevents them from being lost.

Change-Id: I531e24853cf5db8b7c34d91460d3abe786a652de
Closes-bug: 1452919

commit_message:
Hypervisor Support Matrix renders links in notes

The sphinx-extension which renders the support_matrix.ini file into
HTML did not recognize URLs in the notes which have to be written as
an HTML anchor element. This commit changes that. The links are
clickable now.

Closes-Bug: 1451468

Change-Id: Ia05610afb32c7a86536b7f462d3cfc44f9a2ca7d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/85/180985/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: subitem.append(self._create_notes_paragraph(impl.notes)) def _create_notes_paragraph(self, notes): """ Constructs a paragraph which represents the implementation notes The paragraph consists of text and clickable URL nodes if links were given in the notes. """ para = nodes.paragraph() # links could start with http:// or https:// link_idxs = [m.start() for m in re.finditer('https?://', notes)] start_idx = 0 for link_idx in link_idxs: # assume the notes start with text (could be empty) para.append(nodes.inline(text=notes[start_idx:link_idx])) # create a URL node until the next text or the end of the notes link_end_idx = notes.find(" ", link_idx) if link_end_idx == -1: # In case the notes end with a link without a blank link_end_idx = len(notes) uri = notes[link_idx:link_end_idx + 1] para.append(nodes.reference("", uri, refuri=uri)) start_idx = link_end_idx + 1 # get all text after the last link (could be empty) or all of the # text if no link was given para.append(nodes.inline(text=notes[start_idx:])) return para

commit_message:
Add new winimage-builder

* shell script based instead of make
* updated links on required software
* updated PowerShell unattended scripts
* updated autounattend & unattend xml templates files
* checked with Windows Server 2012 R2
* Windows 2008 R2 support - is not refactored(planned)

Change-Id: Id54c363e2c2f3d47f9b48c23a0368beec2fb6102
